org.numenta.nupic.monitor.mixin

Interface MonitorMixinBase

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TemporalMemoryMonitorMixin
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MonitoredTemporalMemory

    public interface MonitorMixinBase
    Base class for MonitorMixin. Each subclass will be a mixin for a particular algorithm. All arguments, variables, and methods in monitor mixin classes should be prefixed with "mm" (to avoid collision with the classes they mix in to). To make a "Mixin":
    1. Create a Decorator interface (A) containing overridden methods
    2. Create MonitorMixinBase extension mixin type (interface) (this does most of the mixin work) see TemporalMemoryMonitorMixin
    3. Create Extension of both MonitorMixinBase and interface (see MonitoredTemporalMemory)
    4. Create constructor in extension class which takes above interface (A) which is the target class which must implement (A)
    5. Make the Original class (see TemporalMemory) to be tested, implement the Decorator interface (A)
    6. Use the "joining" extension class as you would the original class
    Author:
    David Ray
